description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期将军及中华人民共和国政治人物，原副国级领导人。因指挥一·二八淞沪抗战及参与领导福建事变而知名。
description.en: A general during the Republic of China era and a political figure in the People's Republic of China, formerly a national-level deputy leader. He is known for commanding the defense in the January 28 incident and for his role in leading the Fujian Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中国清朝末年，由孙中山等组织的革命团体。
description.en: A revolutionary organization founded by Sun Yat-sen and others in the late Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家、政治家、中华民国国父。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, statesman, and the founding father of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党领导的国民革命军针对北洋军阀的统一战争。
description.en: A military campaign led by the National Revolutionary Army of the Kuomintang against the Beiyang government and its warlords.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期桂系军阀。
description.en: A warlord of the Guangxi clique during the Republic of China era.

description.zh-cn: 国民革命军为统一广东根据地而对陈炯明部队发动的两次军事行动。
description.en: Two military campaigns launched by the National Revolutionary Army against Chen Jiongming's forces to unify the Guangdong base.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国大陆时期军事及政治人物，曾与孙中山合作，后因政治分歧而决裂。
description.en: A military and political figure in the Republic of China, who once collaborated with Sun Yat-sen but later broke with him due to political disagreements.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国高级将领，十九路军的创建者之一，福建事变的主要领导人之一。
description.en: A high-ranking general of the Republic of China, one of the founders of the 19th Route Army, and a key leader of the Fujian Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初年位于广东的一所军事院校。
description.en: A military academy in Guangdong during the early years of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，蔡廷锴的外甥，国民革命军第十九路军将领。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the Republic of China Army, nephew of Cai Tingkai, and a commander in the 19th Route Army.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，国民革命军第十九路军将领，蔡廷锴的同乡。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the Republic of China Army, a commander in the 19th Route Army, and from the same hometown as Cai Tingkai.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，国民革命军第十九路军总指挥，福建事变的主要领导人之一。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China, Commander-in-Chief of the 19th Route Army, and a key leader of the Fujian Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军上将，国民革命军第四军军长，北伐名将。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Army, commander of the Fourth Army of the National Revolutionary Army, and a famous general of the Northern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军创始人之一，南昌起义的领导者之一。
description.en: One of the founders of the Chinese People's Liberation Army and a leader of the Nanchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 由中国共产党领导的针对国民党右派的武装起义，被认为是中共独立领导武装斗争和创建革命军队的开始。
description.en: An armed insurrection led by the Chinese Communist Party against the right wing of the Kuomintang, considered the beginning of the CCP's independent leadership of armed struggle and the creation of a revolutionary army.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，中国人民解放军的创始人和主要领导者之一，南昌起义的领导者之一。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China, one of the founders and main leaders of the People's Liberation Army, and a leader of the Nanchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国元帅，中国人民解放军的创始人和主要领导者之一，南昌起义的领导者之一。
description.en: A Marshal of the People's Republic of China, one of the founders and main leaders of the People's Liberation Army, and a leader of the Nanchang Uprising.

nodes.id: 国民革命军第十九路军

zh-cn: 国民革命军第十九路军

description.zh-cn: 中华民国国民革命军的一支部队，因参与一·二八事变和福建事变而闻名。
description.en: A unit of the National Revolutionary Army of the Republic of China, famous for its participation in the January 28 incident and the Fujian Incident.

description.zh-cn: 指1927年至1949年间在中国发生的系列武装冲突，主要为中国国民党与中国共产党之间的斗争。
description.en: Refers to a series of armed conflicts in China between 1927 and 1949, primarily between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 日本军队于1932年在中国上海挑起的军事冲突，蔡廷锴率领的十九路军进行了坚决抵抗。
description.en: A military conflict instigated by the Japanese army in Shanghai, China in 1932, where the 19th Route Army led by Cai Tingkai offered determined resistance.

description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间日本的国号。
description.en: The official name of Japan from 1868 to 1947.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任中华民国总统及中国国民党总裁。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the leader of the Republic of China and the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，一·二八事变时任淞沪警备司令。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the Republic of China Army, who served as the commander of the Shanghai-Wusong Garrison during the January 28 Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军二级上将，在一·二八事变中率第五军增援十九路军。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China Army who led the Fifth Army to reinforce the 19th Route Army during the January 28 Incident.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国于1925年至1948年的中央政府。
description.en: The central government of the Republic of China from 1925 to 1948.

en: Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在1927年至1937年间领导的武装力量。
description.en: The armed forces led by the Communist Party of China from 1927 to 1937.

description.zh-cn: 由蔡廷锴、李济深、陈铭枢、蒋光鼐等人发动的抗日反蒋事变，在福州成立了中华共和国人民革命政府。
description.en: An anti-Japanese and anti-Chiang incident launched by Cai Tingkai, Li Jishen, Chen Mingshu, Jiang Guangnai, and others, which established the People's Revolutionary Government of the Republic of China in Fuzhou.

nodes.id: 中华共和国人民革命政府

zh-cn: 中华共和国人民革命政府
en: People's Revolutionary Government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 在福建事变期间由十九路军及中国国民党内部分反蒋派系成立的政权。
description.en: A government established during the Fujian Incident by the 19th Route Army and anti-Chiang factions within the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领和政治人物，中国国民党革命委员会的主要创始人和领导人。
description.en: A military general and political figure of the Republic of China, and a main founder and leader of the Revolutionary Committee of the Chinese Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 1935年由李济深、蔡廷锴等人在香港组织的抗日团体。
description.en: An anti-Japanese organization formed in Hong Kong in 1935 by Li Jishen, Cai Tingkai, and others.

description.zh-cn: 中国抗日战争期间，中国军队在广西宾阳县昆仑关对日本军队发动的攻坚战。
description.en: A major offensive launched by Chinese forces against the Japanese army at Kunlun Pass in Binyang County, Guangxi, during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴的第二任妻子。
description.en: The second wife of Cai Tingkai.

nodes.id: 中国国民党民主促进会

zh-cn: 中国国民党民主促进会

description.zh-cn: 中国国民党内的民主派人士于1946年成立的政治组织。
description.en: A political organization founded in 1946 by democrats within the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代革命家、政治家、社会活动家、画家，中国国民党左派的杰出代表。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, politician, social activist, and artist, and an outstanding representative of the left wing of the Kuomintang.

nodes.id: 中国国民党革命委员会

zh-cn: 中国国民党革命委员会
en: Revolutionary Committee of the Chinese Kuomintang

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国现有的八个民主党派之一，由中国国民党民主派及其他爱国民主人士创建。
description.en: One of the eight legally recognized democratic parties in the People's Republic of China, founded by the democratic faction of the Kuomintang and other patriotic democrats.

description.zh-cn: 1948年4月30日由中共中央发布的纪念“五一”劳动节口号，号召“各民主党派、各人民团体、各社会贤达迅速召开政治协商会议，讨论并实现召集人民代表大会，成立民主联合政府”。
description.en: A slogan issued by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on April 30, 1948, to commemorate May Day, calling on all democratic parties, people's organizations, and social luminaries to promptly convene a political consultative conference to discuss and realize the convocation of a People's Congress and the establishment of a democratic coalition government.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、军事家、诗人，中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和第一代最高领导人。
description.en: A Chinese communist revolutionary, politician, military strategist, and poet who was the founding father of the People's Republic of China and its first paramount leader.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的主要武装力量。
description.en: The principal military force of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国1949年至1954年间的最高国家权力机关。
description.en: The supreme state power organ of the People's Republic of China from 1949 to 1954.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国防委员会

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国防委员会
en: National Defence Commission of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国在1954年至1975年期间设立的国家军事机关。
description.en: A state military organ of the People's Republic of China that existed from 1954 to 1975.

en: State Physical Culture and Sports Commission

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院曾经存在的部门，负责全国体育工作，后改为国家体育总局。
description.en: A former department of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, responsible for national sports affairs, later reorganized into the General Administration of Sport.

nodes.id: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会

zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会
en: National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference

description.zh-cn: 中国人民政治协商会议的全国性组织。
description.en: The national-level organization of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国历史上的一场政治运动，由毛泽东发动和领导。
description.en: A political movement in the history of the People's Republic of China, launched and led by Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, who served as the first Premier of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴的原配妻子。
description.en: The first wife of Cai Tingkai.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴的次女。
description.en: The second daughter of Cai Tingkai.

description.zh-cn: 中国清朝时期广东省下辖的一个州。
description.en: A prefecture under the jurisdiction of Guangdong Province during the Qing Dynasty in China.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的首都。
description.en: The capital of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴出生在广东省罗定州罗镜龙岩村。
description.en: Cai Tingkai was born in Longyan Village, Luojing, Luoding Prefecture, Guangdong Province.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴早年参加了同盟会。
description.en: Cai Tingkai joined the Tongmenghui in his early years.

position.zh-cn: 大本营补充团连长、营长
position.en: Company and Battalion Commander of the Headquarters Reinforcement Regiment

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴曾任孙中山大本营补充团连长、营长，并参加其领导的多次战役。
description.en: Cai Tingkai served as a company and battalion commander in Sun Yat-sen's headquarters reinforcement regiment and participated in several campaigns under his leadership.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴参加了孙中山领导的第一次北伐。
description.en: Cai Tingkai participated in the First Northern Expedition led by Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴参加了讨伐桂军沈鸿英的战役。
description.en: Cai Tingkai participated in the campaign against the Guangxi warlord Shen Hongying.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴参加了东征讨伐陈炯明的战役。
description.en: Cai Tingkai participated in the Eastern Expedition campaign against Chen Jiongming.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴在陈铭枢担任营长的肇军游击营中担任排长，并长期受其栽培。
description.en: Cai Tingkai served as a platoon leader in the Zhaojun Guerrilla Battalion where Chen Mingshu was the commander, and was mentored by him for a long time.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴在蒋光鼐担任团长的建国粤军第一师第一旅第二团中担任第一营营长。
description.en: Cai Tingkai served as the commander of the 1st Battalion in the 2nd Regiment of the 1st Brigade of the 1st Division of the National Pacification Army of Guangdong, where Jiang Guangnai was the regiment commander.

description.zh-cn: 在南昌起义前，蔡廷锴的部队归北伐名将张发奎指挥。
description.en: Before the Nanchang Uprising, Cai Tingkai's troops were under the command of the famous Northern Expedition general Zhang Fakui.

description.zh-cn: 在向南京进攻期间，蔡廷锴率领的第十师曾归叶挺指挥跟进。
description.en: During the attack on Nanjing, the 10th Division led by Cai Tingkai was placed under the command of Ye Ting to follow up.

description.zh-cn: 1920年，经陈铭枢保荐，蔡廷锴进入广东护国军讲武堂学习，一年后毕业。
description.en: In 1920, upon Chen Mingshu's recommendation, Cai Tingkai entered the Guangdong National Protection Army Military Academy and graduated a year later.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴率领十九路军在上海对日军的进攻进行了坚决抵抗，是“一·二八事变”中中方的主要指挥官。
description.en: Cai Tingkai led the 19th Route Army in resolute resistance against the Japanese attack in Shanghai, serving as a main Chinese commander during the January 28 Incident.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴在一·二八事变和抗日战争期间，率领部队与日军作战。
description.en: Cai Tingkai led troops to fight against the Japanese army during the January 28 Incident and the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 因不满蒋介石的“攘外必先安内”政策，蔡廷锴发动福建事变，公开抗日反蒋。
description.en: Dissatisfied with Chiang Kai-shek's policy of 'internal pacification before external resistance,' Cai Tingkai launched the Fujian Incident, openly resisting Japan and opposing Chiang.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴与李济深、陈铭枢、蒋光鼐等人共同领导发起了福建事变。
description.en: Cai Tingkai, along with Li Jishen, Chen Mingshu, and Jiang Guangnai, co-led and launched the Fujian Incident.

relationships.target: 中华共和国人民革命政府

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴是福建事变期间成立的中华共和国人民革命政府的创始人之一。
description.en: Cai Tingkai was one of the founders of the People's Revolutionary Government of the Republic of China, established during the Fujian Incident.

description.zh-cn: 福建事变期间，蔡廷锴领导的中华共和国人民革命政府与红军签订了抗日反蒋的初步协定。
description.en: During the Fujian Incident, the People's Revolutionary Government of the Republic of China, led by Cai Tingkai, signed a preliminary anti-Japanese and anti-Chiang agreement with the Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 1935年，蔡廷锴与李济深等人在香港组织中华民族革命大同盟。
description.en: In 1935, Cai Tingkai, along with Li Jishen and others, organized the Chinese National Revolutionary Grand Alliance in Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 抗战初期，蔡廷锴领导军队参加了昆仑关战役。
description.en: In the early stages of the War of Resistance, Cai Tingkai led troops to participate in the Battle of Kunlun Pass.

relationships.target: 中国国民党民主促进会

description.zh-cn: 1946年，蔡廷锴与李济深、何香凝等在广州组织中国国民党民主促进会。
description.en: In 1946, Cai Tingkai, along with Li Jishen, He Xiangning, and others, organized the China Kuomintang Democratic Promotion Association in Guangzhou.

relationships.target: 中国国民党革命委员会

description.zh-cn: 1948年1月，蔡廷锴与李济深等人在香港参与发起组织中国国民党革命委员会。
description.en: In January 1948, Cai Tingkai, along with Li Jishen and others, participated in initiating the organization of the Revolutionary Committee of the Chinese Kuomintang in Hong Kong.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立后，蔡廷锴任中央人民政府委员。
description.en: After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Cai Tingkai served as a member of the Central People's Government Council.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国国防委员会

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立后，蔡廷锴任中华人民共和国国防委员会副主席。
description.en: After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Cai Tingkai served as Vice Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立后，蔡廷锴任国家体育运动委员会副主任。
description.en: After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Cai Tingkai served as Vice Director of the State Physical Culture and Sports Commission.

relationships.target: 中国人民政治协商会议全国委员会

description.zh-cn: 1964年12月至1968年，蔡廷锴任政协全国委员会副主席。
description.en: From December 1964 to 1968, Cai Tingkai served as Vice Chairman of the National Committee of the CPPCC.

description.zh-cn: 1939年蔡廷锴与罗西欧结婚，罗西欧是其第二任妻子。
description.en: Cai Tingkai married Luo Xi'ou in 1939; she was his second wife.

description.zh-cn: 彭惠芳是蔡廷锴的原配妻子。
description.en: Peng Huifang was Cai Tingkai's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 蔡绍芝是蔡廷锴的次女。
description.en: Cai Shaozhi is the second daughter of Cai Tingkai.

description.zh-cn: 区寿年是蔡廷锴的外甥。
description.en: Ou Shounian was Cai Tingkai's nephew.

description.zh-cn: 1940年，蔡廷锴因受蒋介石排挤而去职。
description.en: In 1940, Cai Tingkai was forced out of office due to being sidelined by Chiang Kai-shek.

description.zh-cn: “文化大革命”期间，蔡廷锴作为周恩来运作保护的民主人士之一而未受冲击。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Cai Tingkai was one of the democratic figures protected by Zhou Enlai and thus avoided persecution.

description.zh-cn: 1948年7月1日的豫东战役中，区寿年被中国人民解放军所俘。
description.en: During the Yudong Campaign on July 1, 1948, Ou Shounian was captured by the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 蔡廷锴联名致电毛泽东，响应中共“五一口号”，拥护召开新政协会议。
description.en: Cai Tingkai co-signed a telegram to Mao Zedong, responding to the CCP's 'May 1 Slogan' and supporting the convocation of a new political consultative conference.

description.zh-cn: 五一口号由时任中共中央主席毛泽东领导的中共中央发布。
description.en: The May 1 Slogan was issued by the Central Committee of the CCP, led by then-chairman Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 面对叶挺等人发动的南昌起义，蔡廷锴决定坐视态势发展，消极参与。
description.en: Facing the Nanchang Uprising launched by Ye Ting and others, Cai Tingkai decided to adopt a wait-and-see attitude and participate passively.

description.zh-cn: 贺龙是南昌起义的领导者之一。
description.en: He Long was one of the leaders of the Nanchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 叶挺是南昌起义的领导者之一。
description.en: Ye Ting was one of the leaders of the Nanchang Uprising.

description.zh-cn: 朱德是南昌起义的领导者之一。
description.en: Zhu De was one of the leaders of the Nanchang Uprising.
